title: Re: BIRFDAY
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]I can believe that; Adis has been a nickname I've had since birth, my full name was just too long I think. And my younger brother had the name 'Twunky' from birth till 5 years old.[hr][/quote]
Well that is because Adis is a shortened version of your name. Twelve Thousand doesn't sound like a shortened version of anything.

Unless Mr.12000's REAL name is like... 12000^843. (Stupid EzBoard not displaying ASCII correctly.) In which case I would be lead to think that he is a robot.

You see nicknames USUALLY are just a shortened version of your real name. For example my dad always called me, and probably always will call me, "And." Just "And." Or take my online persona, Galaxieretter, being shortened to just "Gal" to make it pronounceable and typeable... And probably because the name is ironic.

My point is most people don't just get random numbers assigned to their name. I was just wondering as to how this seemingly random numeral was assigned as your psudonym.-----------------------
[url=http://Galaxie.Spatang.com][img]http://img360.imageshack.us/img360/548/blegdandsmeegnewbanner2wf.png[/img][/url]

title: Re: BIRFDAY
content:
After about two weeks of being in this world, my dad's friend saw me and called me "The Davieack 12000" (my name is David). Silly I know, but that name over time was shortened to just Mr. 12000. And when I was like 12 and was looking for a name to go by on the internet, i chose Mr12000. So this silly and random name attached to me as a young one, has become a personal identity of mine as well as my musical artist name, etc. The story behind the name makes it sound kinda lame, but this is truefully how I got it.

Secret's out... Now Ill have to kill you. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-mortlol.gif[/img]



im serious...[img]http://www.denness.net/rpi/username/mr12000[/img]
